BiblioEntry.Title: The Sylvester graph and Moore graphs
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: The Sylvester graph and Moore graphs / A. Jurišić, J. Vidali
BiblioEntry.Abstract: Preučujemo kombinatorno strukturo Sylvestrovega grafa, znanega grafa z visoko ožino. Enostavne tehnike, kot so dvojno preštevanje, particije, lovljenje krogov in krovi, nam pomagajo identificirati manjše strukture, s katerimi pokažemo, da ni drugih grafov, s katerimi si Sylvestrov graf deli majhno število regularnostnih lastnosti. Kot posledico pokažemo enako tudi za Hoffman-Singletonov graf. Opazimo, da imajo nekateri veliko večji grafi z visoko ožino podobne lastnosti, in bi jih lahko morda preučevali s podobnimi tehnikami. Posebej pokažemo, da tako kot Hoffman-Singletonov graf vsebuje Sylvestrov graf, mora tudi Moorov graf valence 57, čigar obstoj je znan odprt problem, vsebovati podgraf s strukturo, ki je podobna tisti, ki jo izpeljemo za Sylvestrov graf.

The combinatorial structure of a famous graph with large girth, namely the Sylvester graph, is studied. Simple techniques, such as two-way counting, partitions, circuit chasing and covers are used to identify smaller structures and to show that there are no other graphs that share a small number of regularity properties with it. As a consequence, we show the same for the Hoffman-Singleton graph. We notice that some much larger graphs with large girth have similar properties, and could be studied using the same techniques. In particular, we show that just as the Hoffman-Singleton graph contains the Sylvester graph, a Moore graph of valency 57, whose existence is a famous open problem, must contain a subgraph with a structure that is similar to the one we derived for the Sylvester graph.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: razdaljno regularni grafi /posplošeni četverokotniki /1-homogenost /kode /lovljenje krogov /Sylvestrov graf /Moorovi grafi
distance-regular graphs /generalized quadrangles /1-homogeneous property /codes /circuit chasing /Sylvester graph /Moore graphs

BiblioEntry.Title: Using symbolic computation to prove nonexistence of distance-regular graphs
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Using symbolic computation to prove nonexistence of distance-regular graphs [Elektronski vir] / Janoš Vidali

BiblioSet.Title: The Electronic journal of combinatorics
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: The Electronic journal of combinatorics [Elektronski vir]

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Razvili smo paket za sistem za računalniško algebro Sage za namene preverjanja dopustnosti presečnih zaporedij razdaljno regularnih grafov. S tem orodjem pokažemo neobstoj razdaljno regularnih grafov s presečnim zaporedjem ▫$\{(2r+1)(4r+1)(4t-1), 8r(4rt-r+2t), (r+t)(4r+1); 1, (r+t)(4r+1), 4r(2r+1)(4t-1)\}$▫ (▫$r, t \ge 1$▫), ▫$\{135, 128, 16; 1, 16, 120\}$▫, ▫$\{234, 165, 12; 1, 30, 198\}$▫ ali ▫$\{55, 54, 50, 35, 10; 1, 5, 20, 45, 55\}$▫. V vseh primerih dokaz neobstoja temelji na enakosti v Kreinovem pogoju, na podlagi katerega računamo trojna presečna števila. Z nadaljnjimi kombinatornimi argumenti nato pokažemo neobstoj.

A package for the Sage computer algebra system is developed for checking feasibility of a given intersection array for a distance-regular graph. We use this tool to show that there is no distance-regular graph with intersection array ▫$\{(2r+1)(4r+1)(4t-1), 8r(4rt-r+2t), (r+t)(4r+1); 1, (r+t)(4r+1), 4r(2r+1)(4t-1)\}$▫ (▫$r, t \ge 1$▫), ▫$\{135, 128, 16; 1, 16, 120\}$▫, ▫$\{234, 165, 12; 1, 30, 198\}$▫ or ▫$\{55, 54, 50, 35, 10; 1, 5, 20, 45, 55\}$▫. In all cases, the proofs rely on equality in the Krein condition, from which triple intersection numbers are determined. Further combinatorial arguments are then used to derive nonexistence.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: razdaljno regularni grafi /Kreinovi parametri /trojna presečna števila /neobstoj /simbolno računanje
distance-regular graphs /Krein parameters /triple intersection numbers /nonexistence /symbolic computation

BiblioEntry.Title: Restrictions on classical distance-regular graphs
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Restrictions on classical distance-regular graphs / Aleksandar Jurišić, Janoš Vidali
BiblioEntry.Abstract: Naj bo ▫$\Gamma$▫ razdaljno regularen graf premera ▫$d \ge 2$▫. Pravimo, da ima ▫$\Gamma$▫ klasične parametre ▫$(d, b, \alpha, \beta)$▫, ko njegovo presečno zaporedje ▫$\{b_0, b_1, \dots, b_{d-1}; c_1, c_2, \dots, c_d \}$▫ zadostuje pogojema ▫$$ b_i = ([d]_b - [i]_b)(\beta - \alpha[i]_b) $$▫ in ▫$$ c_{i+1} = [i+1]_b (1 + \alpha[i]_b) $$▫ (▫$0 \le i \le d-1$▫), kjer je ▫$[i]_b := 1+b+ \dots + b^{i-1}$▫. Poleg znanih družin razdaljno regularnih grafov obstaja veliko presečnih zaporedij s klasičnimi parametri, za katere je obstoj ustreznega grafa odprt problem. Izkaže se, da v večini takih primerov velja bodisi ▫$\alpha = b-1$▫ ali ▫$\alpha = b$▫. Za slednja primera izpeljemo meje za parameter ▫$\beta$▫, kar nam da popolni klasifikaciji, ko velja ▫$b=-2$▫. Razdaljno regularni grafi s klasičnimi parametri so antipodni natanko tedaj, ko velja ▫$b=1$▫ in ▫$\beta = 1 + \alpha[d-1]_b$▫. Če pri tem izpustimo pogoj ▫$b=1$▫, se izkaže, da dobimo dvodelne ali tesne grafe. Za slednje izpeljemo eksplicitne formule za izračun parametrov particij CAB in razdaljne particije glede na neko povezavo. Na koncu najdemo še dvoparametrično družino dopustnih presečnih zaporedij za tesne razdaljno regularne grafe s klasičnimi parametri ▫$(d, b, b-1, b^{d-1})$▫ (slednji so primitivni natanko tedaj, ko velja ▫$b \ne 1$▫) in uporabimo naše rezultate, da pokažemo, da so edini taki grafi ▫$d$▫-kocke ▫$(b=1)$▫.

Let ▫$\Gamma$▫ be a distance-regular graph with diameter ▫$d \ge 2$▫. It is said to have classical parameters ▫$(d, b, \alpha, \beta)$▫ when its intersection array ▫$\{b_0, b_1, \dots, b_{d-1}; c_1,c_2, \dots, c_d \}$▫ satisfies ▫$$b_i = ([d]_b - [i]_b)(\beta - \alpha[i]_b) \quad\text{and} \quad c_{i+1} = [i+1]_b (1 + \alpha[i]_b) \quad (0 \le i \le d-1),$$▫ where ▫$[i]_b := 1+b+ \dots + b^{i-1}$▫. Apart from the well-known families, there are many sets of classical parameters for which the existence of a corresponding graph is still open. It turns out that in most such cases we have either ▫$\alpha = b-1$ or $\alpha=b$▫. For these two cases, we derive bounds on the parameter ▫$\beta$▫, which give us complete classifications when ▫$b=-2$▫. Distance-regular graphs with classical parameters are antipodal iff ▫$b=1$▫ and ▫$\beta = 1 + \alpha[d-1]_b$▫. If we drop the condition ▫$b=1$▫, it turns out that one obtains either bipartite or tight graphs. For the latter graphs, we find closed formulas for the parameters of the CAB partitions and the distance partition corresponding to an edge. Finally, we find a two-parameter family of feasible intersection arrays for tight distance-regular graphs with classical parameters ▫$(d ,b, b-1, b^{d-1})$▫ (primitive iff ▫$b \ne 1$▫) and apply our results to show that it is realized only by ▫$d$▫-cubes ▫$(b=1)$▫.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: razdaljno regularni grafi /klasični parametri /formalno sebi dualni grafi /tesni grafi /lokalno krepko regularni grafi
distance-regular graphs /classical parameters /formally self-dual /tight graphs /locally strongly regular

BiblioEntry.Title: Collisions for variants of the BLAKE hash function
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Collisions for variants of the BLAKE hash function / Janoš Vidali, Peter Nose, Enes Pašalić
BiblioEntry.Abstract: In this paper we present an attack to the BLOKE and BRAKE hash functions, which are weakened versions of the SHA-3 candidate BLAKE. In difference to BLAKE, the BLOKE hash function does not permute the message words and constants in the round computation of the compression function, and BRAKE additionally removes feedforward and zeroes the constants used in each round of the compression function. We show that in these cases we can efficiently find, for any intermediate hash value, a fixed-point block giving us an internal collision, thus producing collisions for messages of equal length in case of BLOKE, and internal collisions for BRAKE.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: BLAKE /BLOKE /BRAKE /collision /cryptography /fixed point /hash functions

BiblioEntry.Title: DiscreteZOO : towards a Fingerprint Database of Discrete Objects
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: DiscreteZOO : towards a Fingerprint Database of Discrete Objects / Katja Berčič, Janoš Vidali
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: towards a Fingerprint Database of Discrete Objects

BiblioSet.Title: Mathematical Software - ICMS 2018 : 6th International Conference, South Bend, IN, USA, July 24-27, 2018 : proceedings
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Mathematical Software - ICMS 2018 / James H. Davenport ...[et al.] (eds.)
BiblioSet.Subtitle: 6th International Conference, South Bend, IN, USA, July 24-27, 2018
proceedings

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Znanih je več poskusov zbiranja matematičnih rezultatov v podatkovne baze z možnostjo iskanja. V tem članku predstavimo DiscreteZOO: repozitorij in bazo prstnih odtisov za diskretne matematične objekte. Trenutno vsebuje zbirke vozliščno tranzitivnih grafov in manipleksov, ki predstavljajo posplošitev tako zemljevidov kot tudi abstraktnih politopov. Projekt vključuje tako orodje za delo z zbirkami objektov in njihovo vzdrževanje, kot tudi spletno stran in paket za SageMath, ki omogočata interakcijo s podatkovno bazo. Cilj projekta je postati splošna platforma za lažje objavljanje zbirk matematičnih objektov in dostop do njih.

Znanih je več poskusov zbiranja matematičnih rezultatov v podatkovne baze z možnostjo iskanja. Trenutno vsebuje zbirke vozliščno tranzitivnih grafov in manipleksov, ki predstavljajo posplošitev tako zemljevidov kot tudi abstraktnih politopov. Projekt vključuje tako orodje za delo z zbirkami objektov in njihovo vzdrževanje, kot tudi spletno stran in paket za SageMath, ki omogočata interakcijo s podatkovno bazo. Cilj projekta je postati splošna platforma za lažje objavljanje zbirk matematičnih objektov in dostop do njih.
